result.execSummary:
The defendant Radell M Combest was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. On one or more other charges, Radell M Combest was found not guilty. These charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Radell M Combest is presumed innocent of the not guilty charges.

  • Radell M Combest was found guilty of Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).
  • Radell M Combest was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
EACH COUNT:  Pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and mandatory surcharges by 6/13/16.  To be paid through collection by DOC from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of Extendd Supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
**10/8/2015  payment  of costs/surcharges extended to February 20, 2017.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.  Credit for 120 days.
**9/5/2014 credit amended to zero days.

Court advised the defendant that due to this domestice violence conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  
No contact with the victim during this sentence.
Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence. Credit for zero days.

Per order of the Presiding Judge, Misdemeanor Division, this motion/request is hereby assigned to the Hon. Rebecca Dallet, Br. 40, for review. mag
DOC request for sentence clarification.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.  Additional statements by:  Precious J.  
AS TO COUNT 2:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 9 MONTHS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 120 days time served.  
.
AS TO COUNT 3:  The Court ordered the Defendant to serve 90 DAYS in the House of Correction, consecutive to any other sentence with credit for 0 days time served. 
*
  Court ordered defendant to pay all applicable court costs, surcharges and mandatory surcharges by 6/13/16. The Court ordered that all court costs, fines, surcharges and/or restitution be paid through collection by the Department of Corrections from 25% of funds under Sec. 973.05(4)(b) and as a condition of extended supervision. DOC shall collect those sums.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Court advised the defendant that due to this domestic violence conviction, he may never possess firearms or ammunition.  NO CONTACT WITH THE VICTIM DURING THIS SENTENCE.  Filed:  Notice of Right to Postconviction Relief and Pretrial Incarceration Credit sheet.
Original Transcript  JURY TRIAL EXCERPT (32 pages) commencing MAY 8, 2014 received and filed.

Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 623.  jew

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
On the same day, at the hour of 4:40 pm the jury returned and by the foreperson brought in a verdict of NOT GUILTY AS TO COUNT 3 (Count 1 of the Information), GUILTY AS TO COUNT 4 (Count 2 of the Information) and GUILTY AS TO COUNT 5 (Count 3 of the Information), which were read in open court.  The Court polled the Jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdicts.  Jury verdicts received and filed.  Jury discharged.  The Court granted defense motion for judgment of acquittal as to Count 3 and denied the defense motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdicts as to Counts 4 and 5.
The Court granted the State's motion for judgment on the verdicts as to Counts  4 and 5 and ordered that judgments of conviction be entered on the record.  Court ordered defendant REMANDED into the custody of the Milwaukee County Sheriff's Department.  Court ordered case adjourned for sentencing in Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.
  Sentencing hearing scheduled for June 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Jury continued deliberations at the hour of 9:12 am to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies M. Tinsley and S. Urbaniak.  Exhibits #'s 3-9 and 12-17 sent to jurors.  Jury in the box and Exhibit #'s1 and 10 played.  Jury resumed deliberations.  At 3:04 pm, the jury was brought into the court and the Allen Instruction was read.  Jury resumed deliberations.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
 Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Jury in the box at 1:45 pm.  Sworn for defense: Tunisha B., Felton M.  Defense rests.  State and defense rest.  Testimony closed.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion to dismiss at close of evidence argued and denied by the court.  Jury in box.  Court instructed jury.  Closing arguments by state and defense.  Court charged the jury.  Alternate juror selected by lot and released.  Jury retired at the hour of 3:55 pm to deliberate in the charge of Sheriff's Deputies M. Tinsley and R. Arezina who were duly sworn for that purpose.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:48 pm.  Jury trial continued to 5/12/14 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Out of the presence of the jury, stipulation put on the record.
Jury in the box at 9:10 am. Trial continued.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officers John Kohler and Derrick Vance.  State rests subject to rebuttal.  Jury out of box.  Defense motion for directed verdict at close of state's case denied by the court.  Court examined defendant as to his right to testify or not to testify and found defendant freely, knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently agreed to testify. Jury in the box.  Sworn for defense: Radell Combest.  Jury excused for lunch at 11:41 am.  Sidebars put on the record.  Jury trial continued to 1:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for May 12, 2014 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Jury in the box at 1:40 pm. Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state: Precious J., Abby A. Exhibit  18 received.  Jury out of box.  Sidebars put on the record.  Jury in the box.  Sworn for the state:  Reona J., Keyonna A., City of Milwaukee Police Officer Joseph Newell.  Exhibit #'s 19, 20 received.  Sworn for the state:  City of Milwaukee Police Officer John Kohler.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:25 pm.  Sidebars put on the record.  Jury trial continued to 5/09/14 at 9:00 am.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Jury in the box at 9:38 am.
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court instructed jury.  Opening statements by state and defense.  Trial proceeded.  Sworn for the state:  Precious J.  Exhibit #'s 1 through 17 received.  Jury excused for lunch at 11:58 am.  Jury trial continued to 1:30 pm.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  2:32 pm.
Thirteen (13) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled.  Jury excused for the evening at 4:31 pm.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Jury trial scheduled for May 8, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Anne M Jaspers in court, defendant Radell M Combest not in court, in custody.  Molly M Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Case set for trial.  Parties are ready to proceed.  Case passed to 1:30 pm.

of Alibi received and filed.  rmm

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne M. Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Ryan T. Sanson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
Final Pretrial held.  Case remains set for jury trial on 5/07/14 in Branch 40.  State withdrew their offer to the defendant.  Court reminds defendant the no contact order remains in effect.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of  PRELIMINARY HEARING commencing  FEBRUARY 17, 2014  received and filed. (19 Pages.)

Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND.

Scheduling Conference held.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  On motion of the state, Court ordered 14CM6 and 14CF507 joined for the purpose of trial.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Final pre-trial scheduled for April 10, 2014 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for May 7, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Molly Schmidt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Information received and filed.  Defense counsel waived reading of the Information and entered a plea of not guilty as to Count 1 on behalf of defendant.

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Anne Jaspers.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Michael Davis Thurston appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.
  Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state: City of Milwaukee Police Officer John Kohler.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Case is adjourned to Branch 40  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect..  Arraignment scheduled for February 19, 2014 at 01:30 pm.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Electronic Monitoring.  Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.  Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Precious J.; TRJ dob 9/11/13; Roena J; Laura J or Keyonna A

Defendant Radell M Combest in court with attorney Adam Galaviz.  Defendant Radell M Combest in custody.  Sara B Lewis appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy Court Clerk:  bm
  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  Defense entered a plea of NOT GUILTY as to Counts 2 & 3.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 17, 2014 at 08:30 am.
